abstract: A Silicon Valley legal drama that has enmeshed three of the world’s most powerful technology companies kicks into high gear on Tuesday as Oracle Corp lays out its case for seeking some $2 billion in damages from rival SAP.
snippet: A Silicon Valley legal drama that has enmeshed three of the world’s most powerful technology companies kicks into high gear on Tuesday as Oracle Corp lays out its case for seeking some $2 billion in damages from rival SAP.
lead_paragraph: A Silicon Valley legal drama that has enmeshed three of the world’s most powerful technology companies kicks into high gear on Tuesday as Oracle lays out its case for seeking some $2 billion in damages from SAP, Reuters reports.

abstract: Oracle’s deal for the e-commerce software provider is the first it has announced since hiring Hewlett-Packard’s deal-making former chief executive, Mark V. Hurd.
snippet: Oracle’s deal for the e-commerce software provider is the first it has announced since hiring Hewlett-Packard’s deal-making former chief executive, Mark V. Hurd.
lead_paragraph: 5:18 p.m. | Updated  Oracle agreed on Tuesday to buy the Art Technology Group, an e-commerce software provider, for about $1 billion.

headline.main: Oracle to Buy Art Technology Group for $1 Billion

abstract: Oracle’s acquisition on Tuesday of the e-commerce software provider Art Technology Group follows several previous deals by Oracle to buy software makers that cater to merchants.
snippet: Oracle’s acquisition on Tuesday of the e-commerce software provider Art Technology Group follows several previous deals by Oracle to buy software makers that cater to merchants.
lead_paragraph: Six weeks ago, Oracle‘s chief executive, Larry Ellison, said that his deal-happy company planned to set its sights on software makers that cater to specific industries.  It found one on Tuesday.

headline.main: Oracle Strikes in Search for Niche Software Makers
